text: Dilip K. Prasad (born 1977) is an Indian academic and computer scientist. He is a professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Tromsø (UiT) in Norway. His work is in the field of artificial intelligence (AI), including topics such as interpretability in deep learning, and diversity policy in AI. He has been included in the Stanford University list of the top 2% most-cited scientists globally in multiple years from 2021 to 2023. == Education == Prasad earned a Bachelor of Technology from the Indian Institute of Technology (Indian School of Mines), Dhanbad, and received his PhD in Computer Engineering from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, in 2013. == Research == Prasad's research focuses on improving AI systems with an emphasis on interpretability, sustainability, and domain-specific applications. He has worked on AI applications in microscopy and nanoscopy, generative AI, and maritime computer vision. == Selected publications == * Somani, A., Horsch, A., & Prasad, D. K. (2023). Interpretability in Deep Learning. Springer. * Sekh, A. A., & Prasad, D. K. (2025). Gender and Diversity Policy in AI. World Scientific. * Sekh, A. A., et al. (2021). "Physics-based machine learning for subcellular segmentation in living cells", Nature Machine Intelligence, 3(12), 1071–1080. * Prasad, D. K., Rajan, D., Rachmawati, L., Rajabally, E., & Quek, C. (2017). "Video Processing from Electro-optical Sensors for Object Detection and Tracking in Maritime Environment: A Survey", IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems, 18(8), 1993–2016. == Recognition == * Included in the Stanford University’s list of top 2% scientists in 2021, 2022, and 2023. * Recipient of the Rolls-Royce Inventor Award in 2016. * Selected for the Kauffman Global Fellowship in 2011. == References == Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:Indian scientists Category:Computer scientists Category:Indian educators
